snippet: President Obama’s selection of a new national security team appears to have ended, at least for now, many of the internal debates about military interventions.
abstract: News analysis; President Obama’s selection of new national security team deeply suspicious of wisdom of American military interventions around the world appears to have ended, at least for now, many internal debates; he has sided with view that caution, covert action and modest military footprint fits the geopolitical moment; tests await in Syria and Iran.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s selection of a new national security team appears to have ended, at least for now, many of the internal debates about military interventions.

headline.seo: Obama Nominees in Step on Light Footprint
headline.main: In Step on ‘Light Footprint,’ Nominees Reflect a Shift

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
